Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise basic”
Reviews.Author: SLawler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Woolbrokers for 3 nights - we booked a twin room but we were surprised to find just two bunkbeds in our room! Reception was friendly and had good advice on hand. Excellent location for Darling Harbour (few mins walk), close to the train and the fish market, and easy to walk into the city. Clean and no problems with noise but feels a bit backpacker-ish at times (there were some ants in the room!) All in all would probably stay again if on a tight budget (although an extra $10/20 dollars/night and you could find something better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GOLDTOUCH
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Nice clean and quiet. Close to everything I need and even the parking is cheap. Stayed here a few times and always going to stay again. The only thing that annoys me is that I can't book in advance due to bookings only opening a few months at a time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: katec62
Reviews.Content: Have just had my second stay at the Woolbrokers and am delighted to report that my first impressions were confirmed. It is very cheap, it is basic, but it is clean and the staff are friendly. Lovely sheets & towels provided with tea & coffee making facilities in room. Shared toilet/shower facilities but have never run in to a problem. The location is out of the way of the tourist traffic but easily accessible to everything too. Hotel room prices in the city are outrageous - Woolbrokers gives you a clean, comfy bed - what more do you need?!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Highlander64
Reviews.Content: The staff couldnâ€™t be more helpful and friendly The location isnâ€™t exactly tourist, but it is convenient. It is meters from the Monorail, tram and the Darling Harbor convention center. If you go left out of the front door you will find Darling harbor. If you go right out the front door you will find a local neighborhood, too me that is the perfect combination. My room was comfortable & clean; it also had a TV, refrigerator, sink and was rather spacious. The Common room./ breakfast area, had a large flat screen, lots of comfortable seating it also had a very nice private patio for smokers or just those who liked a bit of air. The shower rooms were clean and well maintained and there was plenty of hot water with great pressure. Free WiFi was available. While it is billed as a hostel, I would classify it more as a B&B or a nice low budget hotel. I really enjoyed my time there

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, friendly, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Rockinmama
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget accommodation, stayed a week, before going on a cruise. staff was extremely helpful & friendly. We were 'upgraded' to the lower floor as we had a load of luggage...thankfully we didn't have to lug it all upstairs!!!!! The room was very clean.. older style, but who cares as long as its clean. Very close to Darling Harbour & public transport... We expected it to be noisy as it was right on the street, but we didn't hear a thing at night, so it was easy to sleep. For budget accommodation it was 5***** to us & well worth the stay. We would stay here again next time we go to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Poor accommodation but good location!”
Reviews.Author: Emz71
Reviews.Content: The room was cheap for a spot very close to Darling Harbour so location-wise it was great. The bad news is that the room was awful. It smelt mouldy, the curtains did also have a layer of mould along the bottom of them. There was a fan but no aircon, the room was dirty and cramped - it had a random selection of furniture in that looked like it came out of a charity shop, there was a dining room table but no wardrobe or dawers just a hanging rail and about 3 large chairs with a bed pushed up against the wall with thick blankets on (it was the middle of summer!), the carpet thin and lumpy, I tripped over the wrinkles in the carpet most mornings! The room was at the front corner of the building next to the traffic lights which beeped all night and kept us awake. I have stayed in nicer hostels, and this was like a hostel rather than a hotel. There were plently of showers and toilets however because they were shared people did make a complete mess in them, and the aroma was pretty pungent if you didn't get up early (which we did after day 1 for this reason!) The shower head in one room fell onto my fiances head and the tap in another fell off in my hand, the base of the bed also came apart one night and we had to put it back together - we did joke that we were staying in Fawlty Towers! The positives: 1. It was cheap in a very expensive area 2. They have a luggage room so let us store luggage there on our first and last days. 3. There is a washing machine and dryer (watch out for the temperature on the dryer, don't set too hot - I managed to shrink all our socks, I didn't even know this was possible!) 4. There was a fridge in the room (had to clean it with face wipes as it was really dirty however!) If they were to invest some money in doing up the rooms then it could be very pleasant but as it is it's tired and grubby and whilst cheap is not a particularly pleasant place to stay. They offer breakfast for a fee but we didn't think it looked worth it, dry cereal, toast and juice - if you turn left at the (noisy!) traffic lights and walk up the hill there is a great little coffee shop that does breakfast wraps, eggs benedict, bacon rolls and a great flat white fairly cheaply (for the area - everything is expensive so relatively cheap!). If I were to go again I'd probably plump for the nearby Novotel and pay the extra as although we weren't expecting luxury we were expecting it to smell nice, be clean and quiet which it wasn't, so not a great start to our first visit to Oz; out of the six weeks this was the worst place we stayed (unfortunately for 4 nights too!). In summary a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: wenddd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Darling Harbour and staying at the Woolbrokers and I had a great time! My room was awesome! Clean, tidy and in a perfect location! Can't believe how cheap it was! I am totally impressed and will be telling EVERYONE how great it is! I will def be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service but dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Minol
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, really helpful, and the location is ideal. Our gripe is that the rooms had a bad smell, there was mould on the window and curtain, the shower curtain had black mould and brown stains on it, and we itched every night from only what I can imagine were mites of some sort. Our 2 year old had bite marks all over his neck and back from them. The other down side for families with young children or the elderly is that there's no lift, so expect to do a lot of walking up and down stairs with strollers and prams. A shame, because the staff were really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MJBrideJr
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning on our first day in Sydney, after a 23 hour flight from the US we were tired of hauling our bags. Happily they stowed them in their office for us, and gave us directions to Darling Harbour! Oh my goodness! We crossed the street and were right on Darling Harbour...for 89 dollars a night! There were dozens of restaurants, the aquarium, water taxis, IMAX, Maritime Museum all within 5 minutes walk. After 5 hours of sightseeing we returned to the hotel to check in...the sad little awning on the door does invoke a sense of "youth hostel" from my early days of traveling, and the staircase once inside likes to creak loudly (and goes up and up forever), but the rooms had sinks and refrigerators so we were able to shop at the "Woolies" (woolworth's) and have food in our rooms. The rooms varied dramatically, but most had second hand tables and older tv's...however, we were in Australia to see Australia, not watch television or be pampered in our rooms. The staff was friendly and very willing to assist with taxis, directions and advice. We fell in love with Darling Harbour and Sydney, and we couldn't have afforded to stay so close to the harbour anywhere else. If you are a fancy traveler, have a bad back or are a light sleeper, skip this hotel. But if you like an adventure, love to walk about and don't mind sharing a bathroom (in some cases) it is THE BEST VALUE IN AUSTRALIA!

Reviews.Title: “good little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jubbajubba
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here for two nights in Sydney and thought the hotel was great value for money. I paid $69 dollars for single room with a shared bathroom (which i already thought was very cheap), but I had injured my leg so the very kind staff upgraded me without me even asking to a room an ensuite on the ground floor so I didn't have to climb the stairs! The room was simple but very clean, the bed comfortable, the staff very warm and helpful and the breakfast was more than adequate. They have a nice little courtyard to relax in and it is so close to darling harbour that even with my dodgy leg I could walk everywhere I needed to go. Only down side would be a bit of road noise but as the lovely gentleman at reception said unfortunately in the city it's just something that is unavoidable. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “NO NO NO NO NO!”
Reviews.Author: shazza401
Reviews.Content: we had the pleasure of travelling round a fair bit of australia over 6 weeks and stayed in numerous hotels and units, and this was by far the worst, I dont know where the pictures on the hotel description came from but it certainly wasnt the hotel we stayed in, the paint was peeling of the damp walls 5 bunks in a room, we couldnt sleep as any time any one rolled over the squeaking was outrageous! it was so bad our plan to stay in Sydney for 4 days was reduced to 1, an extremely bad experience all round, I imagine the worst kind of backpaker joint would be better than this, My advice avoid avoid avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected, great security and fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: JazzyEC
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel in a twin room for one night. We had a small room with two (surprisingly comfortable!) single beds, a coffee table, TV, sink and bar fridge. While the bathroom facilities were shared we rarely had to wait for people to finish, and they were always immaculately clean. The fact that the front door was locked 24/7 was very comforting - usually one of the things you sacrifice with a cheap hotel is good security. The room door also dead locked behind us so as long as you keep your key on you, you never have to worry about leaving the door unlocked. The only problem was road noise, but I guess you can't complain about that for the price we got the room for! For $95 for the night and such a great location we couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Art162
Reviews.Content: I can't praise the stay I had enough. When you find a place so close to Darling Harbour & it's cheap you think there's got to be a catch... there wasn't any with the Woolbrokers Hotel. It was perfect. The staff were really welcoming & the rooms were great. We had a twin share, ensuit room which was worth the small extra price. The courtyard was cute, the breakfast was yummy, the rooms clean & quiet. Thank you to everyone for making our stay so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: travellers03
Reviews.Content: Brilliant little hotel, very inexpensive and a perfect location (2 minute walk to the light rail station which can take you to central station), and just a minute further on to the convention centre. Rooms were very clean, shared bathrooms were also suprisingly clean. Staff were excellent and will definately stay at Woolbrokers in the future. One small negative, my room was on the side near the road and I was not used to traffic noise, but overall great

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable homely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: flashpierre
Reviews.Content: Recently had the good fortune to stay at the Woolbrokers for the third time in six years as host of an international football team. The experience hasn't changed in all this time despite many staff changes, nothing is ever too much of a problem in this place. Our young footballers have huge appetites and high protein dietary requirements, so the hotel brought in a chef from our region to fulfil all tastes and needs, the food was excellent and the continental buffet breakfast most substantial. The place is very clean and homely, the shared bathrooms even adding to that homely experience. It was once again a delight to stay at the Woolbrokers, we will all be back again to enjoy the excellent location and value this hotel offers it's clientele.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price..”
Reviews.Author: rexelpexel
Reviews.Content: I was recommend the woolbrokers Hotel from a friend. I was a bit cautious from the reviews, but unlike the reviews i had a really nice stay. The hotel was clean, The hotel staff were very accommodating, helpful and friendly. I was satisfied that for the price that i paid, i got value for my money. I got a comfortable room to rest in. The location is fabulous, so must to do and see. Just a two minute walk to Darling harbour. You are not staying at a five star hotel so you cannot expect five star facilities. They are the most reasonly priced hotel in darling harbour. If you are budget traveler this hotel is perfect. I will definelty be booking again next time im in Sydney !

Reviews.Title: “I thought the wool brokers was good value.”
Reviews.Author: Kyles78
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Woolbrokers with my boyfriend and his cousin. It was in a good location near darling harbour. Price was good for this location I thought. Staff good. Also good that you could put your bags in a safe room on your leaving day. Shared bathroom not to bad.

Reviews.Title: “Dont take any chances on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripSydney
Reviews.Content: With the exception of one room which I consider to offer privacy the rest of the hotel is more like a boarding house or guest house. The first time I checked into this hotel I was told the breakfast was included in the room rate but the next morning I was hassled by the one of the hotel staff who kept her eye on me on what I was eating for breakfast! Later I found out I have to pay for breakfast I decided to have it at the Harbourside a few minutes down the road. Smart are they? Got stuffed around with bookings a few times. The worst comment I can give to this hotel is that they do not hold responsiblity for the horrible errors they make but make the guest liable for it including the cost of the room. Perhaps because they have regular group bookings they can afford not to care for individual guest but I think they are wrong.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, but not that great”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a decent place in Sydney to spend a few nights, and I found all the good reviews here and thought I couldn't go wrong. I had been promised I could check in early, but upon arrival, found that wasn't true - ok, no big deal, stored my bags and explored town. Came back at 2pm and checked in, no problem. Room was ok - TV with a few channels but no remote, a fridge (which was a nice surprise), and a loud fan but no a/c...oh well, it wasn't that warm when I was there, but the room was hot after coming back from a long day walking around, so that wasn't all that great. Staff was nice but not overly so, or extremely helpful. Internet access is a joke - go down the street instead. Shared bathrooms were always clean, showers too, so that was nice...had to wait once for about 2 minutes, but other than that, it was pretty easy. Location is great, but don't do what I did and walk all the way down Murray Street to the Maritime Museum - you can cut through the Car Park in the Novotel and through the Monorail Station and be at the heart of Darling Harbour in 2 minutes. Tip for Sydney - take the ferries! It's a little more expensive, but it never gets old sailing under the Bridge or past the Opera House. And do the Bridge Climb - best experience of my trip. All in all - I would stay here again if on a budget, but if I had any money to spend, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bucket not Boutique”
Reviews.Author: oztravellerScotland
Reviews.Content: Sounded a great place on previous reviews but the hotel is under new management and quite a few things have changed. There is now no 'FREE' breakfast and the 'Boutique' rooms applies to a few bits of chintzy furniture dotted about the place. There are ample bathroom facilities, which are generally clean but the hotel has a few health and safety issues, such as a big colour TV balancing on the draining board in the bedrooms which gets splashes when the the sink is used. The location is ok, apart from noisy dustmen who appear early every morning Overall the hotel would be better placed on Dover docks rather than the great city of Sydney!!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world service”
Reviews.Author: AnneB32
Reviews.Content: we spent a fortnight at the woolbrokers in Sydney. The major plus points are the location - it's literally round the corner from darling harbour and a 1/3rd of the price that the novotel and Ibis charge. More importantly I've never received such warm and friendly hospitality in a hotel anywhere ever. Nothing is too much trouble for Sandy and Caroline who run the place. Just a few examples of this - we were upgraded free of charge to a room with a larger bed because we were both tall, they gave us food on a few occasions without charge, lent us DVDs to watch, helped find a dentist for my husband when his filling fell out, helped us with car bookings, taxis to the airport and suggestions on places to go. They were simply superb and if they are still running this place next we go to Sydney we'll definitely be staying there. Other plus points about the hotel - the standard breakfast is a bit basic and repetitive but you can order enormous yummy cooked breakfasts, there's a laundry in the hotel and ironing boards and irons dotted around which came in handy and an internet terminal. The shared toilets and bathrooms are kept clean and overall it's a tight run ship. The decor isn't brilliant but it's clean and hey you are paying $89 a night and the location is fantastic. you are near a monorail, a tram stop, darling harbour is 2 seconds away, there's good restaurants and shops nearby in either direction and outside of the hotel and up the stairs is a walkway that brings you out into the centre of Sydney. what more can I say, I loved the place. A few 5 star hotels I know would do well to come and take lessons in customer service from these guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Trotter
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this location. Across the street from the Novatel Hotel in Darling Harbour but is hundreds less in price. Granted this is not an opulent place, but who cares, it would be criminal to sit in your room instead of seeing the sights. Very convenient to the action and you don't need to be near Circular Quay to catch ferries since they leave from Darling Harbour as well. Can't beat this area for restaurants, bars, entertainment, etc etc. Caroline, Peter, and Sandy couldn't be any more friendly or helpful. I'd return just to see them again! Breakfast is adequate and don't worry about the shared bathrooms. There are so many bathrooms, you'll never have to wait. Have a great time in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel bargain in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is hard to imagine a better value than the Woolbrokers if you are staying in Sydney. The place is super clean and the staff is very helpful and the rates are more than fair. I have stayed here 3 times for about 3 days each time and have had wonderful experiences. The location is very close the the action of Darling Harbor and its sights. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this bed and breakfast 3 times and everytime we have had a fantastic stay. The staff are wonderful and the location is perfect, you only have to walk across one quiet road and you are in Darling Harbour and at the Monorial which will take you right into the city. Breakfast consists of toast and cereal which you help yourself to and the accommodations are warm and inviting. The bathrooms are communal but every stay we almost had a whole floor to ourselves - this is Sydney's best kept secret! Be sure to consider this B&B when you next visit!

HotelInfo.Name: Woolbrokers Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 22 Allen Street | Pyrmont, Sydney, New South Wales 2009, Australia
